title: Bug 120922 - 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description:
When editing the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and then trying to switch back to the Layout view, the following behavior is observed:
- A dialog box with the title 'Error' (including the quotes) is displayed.
- The error message in the dialog box is 'Source page is dirty.' (including the quotes).
- The user is prompted with the options 'Yes', 'No', and 'Cancel' to save, discard, or do nothing with the changes, respectively.

The observed problem is that it is unclear to the user how to save or discard the changes and the error message is not very informative.

Expected behavior:
- The dialog box should have a more informative title, without the quotes.
- The error message should provide clear instructions on how to save or discard the changes.

Steps to reproduce the issue:
1. Open the XML Report Designer editor.
2. Switch to the 'source' view.
3. Make some changes to the XML.
4. Attempt to switch back to the Layout view.

The 'Dirty Page' behavior and error message should be improved to provide clear instructions to the user on how to save or discard changes.
